revised_title: In-situ Photodimerization of Anthracene Single Crystals using Electron Microscopy
tldr: Researchers used an electron microscope to study the photodimerization of anthracene single crystals in real-time. They found that the crystals converted to dianthracene with a high degree of regularity and crystallinity. The process provided insights into the solid-state reactions and crystal structures of the reacting species.
